intro: Hydrophyllum appendiculatum, commonly known as the narrowleaf blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in sagebrush steppe and desert environments. Its leaves are narrow and grayish-green, with a fuzzy texture, and it produces small blue to purple flowers. Hydrophyllum appendiculatum is adapted to arid conditions and plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
